content: ice cream cone dish cloth sally ives/july 2004 materials about 3/4 oz each of cone colour and ice cream colour crochet hook size 4 5mm g hook app size 11 x 9 notes always start row of double_crochet with chain 3 counts as first double_crochet always start row of single_crochet with ch1 single_crochet in same st ch1 does not count as first st with cone colour ch25 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook and across turn 23 row 2-5 double_crochet across turn at end of row 5 ch5 turn row 6 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook and across to last double_crochet double_crochet in last st yo insert hook in same st as last double_crochet * yo draw up loop twice yo draw through 2 loops twice * yo insert hook in base of last hook repeat * to * twice you will have 29 double_crochet increased 3 at each end row 7-11 double_crochet across turn fo at end of 11 with ice cream colour ch4 slip_stitch to form ring row 1 7dc in ring turn do not spread stitches to cover ring we are making a semi-circle from here row 2 2dc in each st across turn 14 row 3 2dc in 1 st double_crochet in next across turn 21 row 4 2dc in 1 st double_crochet in 2 across 28 row 5 single_crochet in 3 sts 2sc in in 6 half_double_crochet in 5 2hdc in next double_crochet in 4 2dc in next 4 times double_crochet in 4 2hdc in next half_double_crochet in 5 single_crochet in last 6 do not turn ch1 single_crochet 29 stitches evenly across bottom ch1 hold both pieces wrong sides together with wide side of cone matched with flat side of ice cream turn so cone side is toward you work 1 row of single_crochet through both layers thus through back loops of cone and front loops of ice cream 29 single_crochet turn for frill ch2 2hdc in same st 3hdc in each st across fo if desired work 1 round of single_crochet evenly around cone part of cloth for a more finished look
